executive_summary: Cement is used predominantly in concrete products, with demand from ready-mix concrete producers accounting for a large percentage of revenue. Since concrete is used heavily in construction activities, the industry is dependent on investment in infrastructure, utilities, public works and residential and nonresidential construction. Over the five years to 2024, demand has fluctuated alongside downstream residential construction activity, which boomed early on but then fell off amid interest rate hikes, causing the industry to endure an overall decline. Cement Manufacturing industry revenue has contracted at a CAGR of 1.1% over the past five years and is expected to total $9.9 billion in 2024, when revenue will jump by an estimated 1.4%. Profit has decreased over the past five years amid rising labor and purchase fees.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Cement is mostly used in building-related materials
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Most construction projects, including those for infrastructure, utilities, public works, private nonresidential projects and residential projects, employ concrete. Because of this, the downstream construction markets significantly impact the cement manufacturing industry's revenue.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: There are very high capital requirements
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Due to the substantial upfront costs associated with establishing production facilities and robust internal competition, businesses find it challenging to enter the industry.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Interest rates will continue to remain high over the outlook period. Since home building and renovation projects take a relatively short amount of time to complete, the level of activity within the residential building market is highly susceptible to the price of financing.

Going into 2029, revenue will be supported by increased government financing for highways, rising utility construction costs, and significant growth in the number of nonresidential construction projects.

The number of industry enterprises is anticipated to remain steady despite revenue increases. An industry typically sees more new companies enter as demand grows and profit remains steady. However, the industry has various obstacles to entry that prevent new players from entering.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: A Depreciating Dollar Will Boost Exports
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The boost in industry revenue can be attributed to favorable trade conditions over the next five years. Domestic cement manufacturers will benefit from relatively strong international demand for higher quality products.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Continuous Government Funding Will Support Cement Manufacturing
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act (IIJA) provides $1.2 trillion to modernize the nation's infrastructure, including $550.0 billion above the baseline investment. Nearly $746.0 billion in IIJA funding remains to be allocated as of June 2024, indicating future opportunities for industries like Cement Manufacturing.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry manufacture cements, including portland, natural, masonry and pozzolanic cements for use in construction. This industry does not produce lime, which is an ingredient in cement, nor does it produce concrete, which uses cement as an input.
key_trends: All cement manufacturers compete on price. Cement companies are under intense pressure to keep prices and costs low because many different types of cement are considered homogeneous.

A rising dollar made foreign imports more affordable, causing imports as a percentage of domestic demand to increase over the past five years. This trend will reverse over the outlook period as the dollar depreciates.

As time passed, market volatility in the construction sector contributed to the industry's decline. Residential construction, in particular, started to fall in 2022 as a result of overbuilding in prior years and the rise in interest rates.
The highway building market has expanded alongside increased government investments. The Bipartisan Infrastructure Deal allocates funding to rebuild roads, bridges and rails.
The industry displays a moderate amount of concentration. The top four businesses are expected to account for under half of total revenue in 2024.
Cement production in the United States is impacted by several federal, state and local government laws. The US is the third-largest industrial emitter of airborne pollutants, per the EPA.

The building markets expanded in reaction to the rise in utility costs in the construction industry. This has led to a gradual expansion of the Cement Manufacturing industry and the benefits will be realized over the outlook period.

The cost and price of cement determine the profitability of cement producers. Manufacturers are often able to charge higher cement prices and boost profit when there is an increase in demand from downstream sectors.

Depending on how much money is spent on construction, cement demand changes. Demand for cement manufacturing decreases as credit becomes tighter and investments in new homes, businesses and public buildings slow down.

market_segmentation.segment_description: The Biggest Clientele Group is Served by Ready-Mixed Concrete Producers. Ready-mix cement is a crucial ingredient in concrete, which arrives ready to use and doesn't require the addition of aggregates or other ingredients. Ready-mix concrete is also produced by all of the major companies in the cement manufacturing industry. Demand from this market segment has fluctuated alongside downstream residential construction activity. Lower interest rates in the first half of the period caused demand to increase, while higher interest rates in the latter half reversed this trend. Nonetheless, demand from the commercial market has moderately offset this, causing this market to increase over the past five years.

Concrete product manufacturers are always needed. Manufacturers in this sector create concrete-based goods such pipes, bricks, blocks and concrete, which are used in a range of construction projects like sewers and buildings. This market is relatively small compared to cast-in-place, ready-mix concrete because of the weight and complexity of transporting concrete goods. Demand from this market decreased over the past five years as ready-mixed concrete producers now accounts for a larger portion of cement purchases.

Demand from other buyers have decreased over the past five years. The other segment includes a variety of customers, such as contractors, oil and gas drillers, building materials dealers and more. Companies purchasing cement for this market typically resell concrete without processing it, but may also process small quantities of cement into concrete themselves. This segment decreased in revenue share because of lower demand from building material dealers and the increased revenue share from ready-mix concrete manufacturers instigated by wholesale bypass.

products_and_services.product_description: Portland and Masonry Cement are Produced Heavily by Manufactures. Masonry mortar can be created by combining cement, sand and water. Then, it's applied to buildings built of stone, brick and block. Stucco can also be made with cement. Portland or mixed hydraulic cement is often combined with other materials to make masonry cement. The cement can be produced in a number of colors as well, depending on personal preferences in terms of aesthetics.
Most Cement Products Employ Clinker as a Binder. Clay and limestone are typically fused together at high temperatures to create cement clinker. Clinker is used as a binder in the majority of cement.

tier_2_suppliers: Iron & Steel Manufacturing in the US
Electric Power Transmission in the US

Concrete Pipe & Block Manufacturing in the US
Stone, Concrete & Clay Wholesaling in the US
Ready-Mix Concrete Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Activity within the residential construction sector largely determines demand for the Cement Manufacturing industry. Cement is a primary input for concrete and mortar used in constructing apartments and condos, among other residential spaces. When demand from the residential construction sector increases, it positively affects the industry and vice versa. Growth in the value of residential construction represents a potential opportunity for the industry.

Clinker is widely sold both domestically and internationally, especially to regions where raw materials are hard to come by because it does not depreciate considerably for months if kept in dry circumstances. Because of the inherent value, demand for this product segment has remained strong over the past five years.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Also, cost considerations play a significant role in the boost in imports. Some countries have lower production costs due to factors such as lower labor costs or access to abundant raw materials. These cost advantages allow foreign cement manufacturers to offer their products at more competitive prices than domestic producers.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Importing Cement Can Offer Supply Chain Benefits to US Companies
international_trade_points.trade_description: The availability of imported cement allows for the diversification of sources and reduces reliance on a single supplier. This diversification can provide more stability in the supply chain and mitigate potential disruptions caused by factors such as natural disasters, labor disputes, or production issues.

One key factor is the dominance of domestic demand in the US market. The construction sector, including residential, commercial and infrastructure projects, represents the primary consumer of cement products. Demand for cement within the country is driven by ongoing construction and infrastructure development projects.

The transportation costs associated with exporting cement pose a significant challenge. Cement is a heavy and bulky product, making it costly to transport over long distances. The expenses related to shipping, logistics and handling can reduce the competitiveness of US cement manufacturers in international markets.

international_trade_points.trade_title: THE AVAILABILITY OF LOCALLY PRODUCED CEMENT IN MANY COUNTRIES CONTRIBUTES TO THE LIMITED DEMAND
international_trade_points.trade_description: The availability of locally produced cement in many countries contributes to the limited demand for US exports. Numerous countries have their own cement manufacturing industries, producing cement to meet their domestic needs. These countries often prioritize supporting their local cement producers, leading to self-sufficiency and reduced reliance on imported cement.

business_locations.location_description: To avoid transporting large quantities of rock or concrete by land, manufacturers in this region frequently look to take advantage of low-cost international shipping rates for inputs and completed commodities. California is particularly attractive due to its large consumer markets and strong housing demand.

With their large populations and high building demand, states like Florida and Texas with large populations help the region's production. The Southwest is also seeing significant population growth, making the Southeast the country's most populous region. This makes it easy for producers to reach customers downstream. In addition, Mexico, one of the main export markets for the industry, isn't far from the southern regions. Compared to other regions, the Southeast has the most quarries and mines for stone.

One of the biggest manufacturing centers in the country is the area around the Great Lakes, which is home to several manufacturers of building materials and other goods. Additionally, a sizable portion of the US population lives in the area. It offers access to a big consumer base and the housing market as a result.

Given the large number of quarries in the Plains area, businesses construct facilities there. Many stone mining and quarrying businesses are located in the area, allowing for vertical integration and cost reductions.

With one of the greatest populations in the nation and significant cities like New York City, Philadelphia, Baltimore and New Jersey, the Mid-Atlantic region is an excellent location for cement manufacturers serving metropolitan building markets.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Strict environmental laws regarding the amount and make-up of plant emissions into the atmosphere apply to the cement manufacturing industry. Mercury, sulfur dioxide, nitrogen oxide, fine soot and other allowable.
Emissions levels were dramatically reduced by the emissions guidelines that the (EPA) imposed for portland cement-producing facilities.

All cement marketed in the United States must conform to US standard classifications. Most manufacturers are required to have quality accreditation ISO 9002. These standards cover both the uniformity of cement strength and the methods for sample testing cement and additives.

In response to Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) guidance, various levels of regulation have been implemented in the United States and overseas to discourage public gatherings, large events or crowded, unsafe work environments.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry assistance level is low and steady.
The competition level is high and steady.

factors_decreased_barrier: The industry is subject to strict environmental laws regarding emissions.
Most business owners own permits and rights for raw material supplies.

basis_points.basis_description: Cement manufacturers differentiate themselves by holding leases on the most economically efficient quarries, restricting new entrants from accessing raw materials.

concentration_points.concentration_description: There is a moderate level of concentration in the market.

Concentration has fluctuated over the past five years as large businesses rely on mergers and acquisitions for expansion and cost control, but has ultimately increased as a few large companies dominate the industry.
Many smaller manufacturers have increasingly catered to niche markets to effectively compete and reduce susceptibility to competitively priced imports.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases as a share of revenue have increased over the past five years.
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The main expense for the industry is purchases. Crushed rock, limestone, gypsum, industrial sand, water, blending additives, fly ash, slag and other aggregate materials are needed to make cement.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: The Manufacturing of Cement is a Highly Capital-Intensive Enterprise Due to the Specialized Machinery
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Since it requires specialized machinery, including quarries, driers, coolers and cement plant motors, cement manufacturing is a very capital-intensive.

Wages as a share of revenue have increased over the past five years. Although the industry continually incorporates new technology to ease the production of standardized products, it remains labor-intensive. Cement manufacturers require skilled workers and designers for many of their products, especially within niche segments.
Profit as a share of revenue has decreased over the past five years. This decline is contributable to higher labor and purchase fees.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: The ability to operate in the business successfully requires a specific understanding of the equipment and client preferences.

volatility_points.volatility_title: THE AMOUNT OF ACTIVITY IN THE CONSTRUCTION SECTOR AFFECTS CEMENT DEMAND
volatility_points.volatility_description: Interest rate changes, cement price swings, residential and commercial development values and overall infrastructure investment all impact the construction industry. The residential construction market, particularly new housing starts, is the largest single-market determinant of industry performance.

volatility_points.volatility_title: THE SLIGHT VARIANCE IN GROWTH RATES IS DUE TO CYCLICAL DOWNSTREAM MARKET CONDITIONS
volatility_points.volatility_description: The industry expanded at the start of the period because of favorable trends in the construction markets, but it started to contract as a result of the changing monetary policy, which caused volatility in the construction markets.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: By concentrating new capital investment in facilities that employ the dry kiln/preheated manufacturing technique and phasing out businesses that rely on the more energy-intensive wet process, the industry has improved efficiency over the preceding two decades.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: INVESTMENTS IN AUTOMATED EQUIPMENT CONTINUES TO INCREASE
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Distributed control systems (DCSs) use setpoint control to regulate material flow through the plant. DCSs are connected to sensors and actuators. They maintain the effectiveness of the facility and keep an eye on emissions and pollution.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in a niche or do you produce cement for a specific market niche?
FAQs.answer: The majority of companies in the industry are mid-sized regional players that can gain a competitive advantage by specializing in certain products based on regional preferences. The industry is also characterized by larger international players that are gaining market share.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of a specific building segment in the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Product sales are dependent on construction activity. Typically, when the economy is healthy, there is higher construction activity, stimulating demand for industry products. However, residential, commercial and industrial building markets can demand different cement mixes for optimal concrete performance. Focusing on meeting the demands of all sectors can increase financial stability.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: The price of sand has consistently risen over the past five years. This has led to increasing input prices, which are then passed on to consumers in the form of higher prices for end products. Securing long-term deals for cement-quality sand or working with suppliers to reduce the need for high-priced sand may reduce overall costs.

FAQs.question: Has your company located near key downstream distributors to reduce shipping costs?
FAQs.answer: Being close to distribution centers decreases transportation costs, especially because cement is heavy and difficult to move. Locating near bulk transportation access such as a railroad or seaport can reduce per-unit shipping costs dramatically.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs through automation over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Automation has helped to speed up the manufacturing process and allows for a standard end-design for company products. Consequently, we have continued to further invest in automating the manufacturing process. The rollout of 5G wireless networks streamlines industry operations further, as faster wireless internet makes more extensive automation processes feasible.

FAQs.question: How is your company leveraging technology to provide additional value or produce additional cement product?
FAQs.answer: Technologies such as robots capable of heavy lifting have helped to decrease operating expenses and work-related injuries. Moving forward, concrete companies will continue integrating 3D printing technologies and faster 5G wireless service into their operations as well.

FAQs.question: How does your company capitalize on meeting regulations such as energy-efficiency standards?
FAQs.answer: Investment in eco-friendly manufacturing locations and CO2 reducing technologies can lead to a domino effect where other processes such as transportation also become more energy efficient. Corporate focus on reducing ecological footprints may also increase demand for companies that demonstrate class-leading environmentally-friendly practices.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Implementing standard operating procedures and enforcing clear guidelines helps to minimize any potential health or safety issues. Ensuring that safety equipment and PPE is a habit in your workplace prevents a significant number of injuries and lawsuits.

FAQs.question: How has price volatility of final markets affected profit margin?
FAQs.answer: Residential demand is highly susceptible to the price of financing and inputs due to short construction times. Nonresidential construction is more reliant on overall macroeconomic health. Profit is fairly low and consistent.

FAQs.question: What percentage of your company's customers renew their contracts?
FAQs.answer: Because many companies are regional players that cater to geographic trends and preferences, they can develop strong relations with customers. This leads to high customer retention.

FAQs.question: What quality control processes do you have in effect? Is your company known for the quality of its services and products?
FAQs.answer: Cement manufacturers require access to quality raw materials, including limestone and blending agents. Quality is a major differentiating factor.

FAQs.question: Is your company dominant in any particular regional markets? What range does your company have in terms of viable operating area?
FAQs.answer: The bulky nature of cement raises transport costs and restricts the market threshold. Manufacturing is therefore located close to the main sources of demand.

FAQs.question: How do you keep track of the company's expenditures? What costs can you cut back on, especially during slower months?
FAQs.answer: The industry is highly seasonal. Companies must be capable of managing large seasonal swings in cement and clinker inventories. Make sure to track changing demand for various sectors in the industry, as these markets are not highly volatile and can be predicted to optimize inventory of specific products.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor the trade-weighted index? How can you keep domestic customers when the trade-weighted index is high?
FAQs.answer: Cement imports and exports are affected by the value of the dollar relative to other currencies. As the trade-weighted index (TWI) rises, industry products become relatively more expensive for global consumers, decreasing demand for industry exports.

FAQs.question: Housing starts
FAQs.answer: Cement is a primary input in housing construction. The Cement Manufacturing industry is particularly sensitive to cyclical growth and overall macroeconomic performance, which may affect consumers' willingness to purchase lands and homes.

FAQs.question: Commercial and industrial building markets
FAQs.answer: Cement is a primary input for concrete and mortar, which are used in the construction of office blocks and manufacturing facilities. Therefore, nonresidential construction drives demand for cement.
